meanings.definition: Not reduced in size or scope
meanings.sent1: The uncontracted book was still thick and had many pages.
meanings.sent2: The uncontracted shirt was loose and comfortable to wear.
meanings.sent3: The uncontracted balloon refused to shrink no matter how much air was let out.
meanings.sent4: Her uncontracted enthusiasm filled the room with energy.
meanings.sent5: The uncontracted forest stretched out endlessly, full of tall trees and wildlife.

meanings.definition: Not made smaller or more compact
meanings.sent1: The uncontracted suitcase took up a lot of space in the trunk.
meanings.sent2: The uncontracted blanket covered the entire bed with its warmth.
meanings.sent3: The uncontracted marshmallow was so big, it barely fit in the cup of hot chocolate.
meanings.sent4: His uncontracted laughter echoed through the room, filling it with joy.
meanings.sent5: The uncontracted cloud blocked the sun, casting a large shadow over the field.

meanings.sent1: The uncontracted worker was not bound by any specific terms.
meanings.sent2: The uncontracted agreement left both parties free to make other choices.
meanings.sent3: The uncontracted artist preferred to work independently without any formal agreements.
meanings.sent4: Her uncontracted status allowed her to explore different opportunities.
meanings.sent5: The uncontracted partnership was based on trust and mutual understanding.
